author: allisonfromm
title: Roadmap to Creating a Legal Entity
description:
Os empreendedores precisam de uma estrutura legal para impostos e contabilidade e para levantar fundos de capital de risco.
Profissionais da área tributária e contábil não têm experiência em criptografia.

f6_assessments.q0: Simple plan and relatively inexpensive plan to document the process of setting up a corporate structures for crypto businesses covering the US, Switzerland and Australia. Would be a great resource.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers have the experience to do this and are already on in the process for their own entities. I would expect them to be able to produce the documentation for others to follow in their footsteps. Lets not have every project re-inventing the wheel.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer have a simple plan and delivery will be easy to audit. They have noted that even a great document is no use if no one reads it. It would be nice to have some goals on usage of their documents over given timeframes.

f6_assessments.q0: There are three issues here: 1) Legislation and regulations regarding cryptoeconomy are in constant flux, 2) Such information is place-dependent, 3) The focus is on starting up traditional business entitties and there are already millions of public and private sources of assistance providing this information.
f6_assessments.q1: Allison and Philip are renowned members of the Catalyst community and will always deliver what they promise. The plan, however, has some holes in it. As becomes obvious from reading the comments, this kind of "roadmap" should consider DAOs, nonprofit entities and other non-traditional, non-business approaches. Collaborating with the people who commented (and others) in Fund8 can strengthen the team, widen the scope and make it a truly global knowledge repository. However, this still needs to be managed and updated. A one-off report is not sufficient. A wiki + confirmed contributors are still needed.
f6_assessments.q2:
Not quite sure what are the said "Legal Expenses" ($2,500) and "Accounting Expenses" ($1,500) payable to the identified companies.

Place-dependency makes the auditability a bit difficult. Not to mention that the results won't be relevant to someone starting their blockchain business (or DAO) in e.g. Mexico, India, Sweden or Kazakhstan.

Unless specifically limited by the challenge scope, Treasury-funded proposals should be relevant for the entire Catalyst community.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposed solution (a professional guide / tool to assist ADA-paid entrepreneurs in creating a legal entity) aligns very well to the campaign by providing a tool that amplifies and commercializes catalyst / cardano startups. The common problem is stated clearly and within the scope of the challenge.  Like the challenge intends, this document is global in scope as the team has expertise in American, Swiss, and Australian business.
f6_assessments.q1: I am highly confident this document will be created successfully, AND be an integral part of the catalyst eco-system (perhaps beyond).  The two person, international team is capable as evidenced by the clear and thoughtful proposal, activity in the community and relevant experience in linkedIn profile.    One concern is the lack of clarity, on my part, of the style or design of the 'document'.  Perhaps voters would be persuaded by a visual representation.
f6_assessments.q2: There is a detailed roadmap and a clear definition of success, the document will or will not be completed in the timeframe, budget and addressing the proposed subject headings.  The budget seems reasonable to create a polished, professional, referenced document.

f6_assessments.q0: With hope, your team experiences would benefit and make a pathway for entrepreneurs can use project outcomes as references and apply them to their jurisdictions and in cryptocurrency generally.  And particular on how to increase the legacy businesses to use Cardano ecosystem and ADA.
f6_assessments.q1: Acknowledge with your team listed skillsets and span over three countries. However, it should take a closer and stronger link to how entrepreneurs choose Cardano over other blockchains and nine listed possible points in auditability. For instance, the taxation issue should provide a small explanation of how your team is likely to deal with this hot like potato matter that most Central banks are pulling their hair currently to ensure can be taxable on crypto investors and possible to tackle crypto tax fraud.
f6_assessments.q2: Should cover/divert further contents from two provided URL that support direct Cardano entrepreneurs as the highest priority and the rest cryptocurrency. As mentioned, taxation in feasibility, the marked DONE item 1 and 2 (from Milestones and KPIs) mostly listed the standard and general tax terms and yet have provided a great deal or methodology to address nor support directly to Cardano, blockchain, cryptocurrency and entrepreneurs. I hope the deliverable items can be improved massively if the project is able to obtain the fund.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem statement and the solution prevent risks which could all funded projects face. The proposer could improve the proposal by elaborating the advantage (time, cost) of not having to deal with those 'circumstances'. The solution is beneficial for the Catalyst ventures and the demographic information is layer out very detailed.  What remains open is an estimated size how many projects may benefit from it. When the proposal is delivered it could be a massive time saver for all first time entrepreneurs who never run their own legal entity. It has huge potential to scale and to address further challenges.
f6_assessments.q1:
* The proposing team provides evidence (references, linking, twitter) to prove relevant skills and experience which is needed to deliver the proposal successfully. The proposal provides a detailed plan, monthly deliverables and a reasonable budgeting & budget break down to achieve the set goals. 
* In order to improve this proposal, the proposer could consider challenges and risks which could prevent a successful implementation.
f6_assessments.q2: Roles, accountabilities of the proposers, the included parties to plan, perform and deliver the solution is presented in an understandable way. What remains open if the proposed solution helps all Swiss, US and Australian entrepreneurs, or if it includes a workaround from Asian, African and European participants to use the same documents and run a business from their countries in the 3 addressed ones. What the proposer could mention in an updated version is how to deal with updated jurisdiction in the mentioned countries.

f6_assessments.q0: It is a very important proposal for the Cardano Community in the way that helps to normalise the Ada and to make easy the life of the community members that want to work and win money in Ada and don't want to have taxation problems.
f6_assessments.q1: She is highly experienced, her studies and her former job in banking (see her Linkedin profile as a reference) demonstrates her capabilities to achieve this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: She specifies every step of the process, so yes, the information is more than enough.

solution: Documentar como criar uma pessoa jurídica utilizada para fins contábeis, fiscais e financeiros para um empresário que está sendo pago na ADA.
